update.description:
Loading configs

* Default config tags of ‘visible’, ‘scene’ and ‘title’ will be parsed by all display plugins individually in the DisplayPlugin base class' `Load` \(not ‘engine’ because ogre is required at the moment, e.g. because of [#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/69](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/69/add-setvisible-for-visual/diff)\)
* Custom configs can be passed through to display plugins via their `Initialize` method. GridDisplay, for example, can have the colour etc of its grid customised.

Saving configs

* General config properties are saved in `DisplayPlugin::Config`
* Custom configs can be saved by specifying e.g. `GridDisplay::CustomConfig`.

Tests have been added to check that the same state of e.g. GridDisplay can be reloaded after modifying the grid’s properties.
update.title: Loading/saving of display plugin configs

content.raw: Nice [test coverage](https://codecov.io/bb/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/tree/355ea9ec0f1aa021bc695eff0a1d3b75d00d5cc6)! Just waiting on a last round of CI
content.html: Nice test coverage! Just waiting on a last round of CI

content.raw:
I modified the DisplayPlugin tests to not rely on the Displays widget in [#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/commits/10d4992697ab3833b7283b4ede891a7e20e3e71b?at=default](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/commits/10d4992697ab3833b7283b4ede891a7e20e3e71b?at=default)

and moved the Displays-specific testing \(e.g. toggling the visibility\) to Displays\_TEST in [#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/commits/89e10db00fc0bf2779b11a50c8fb9b401c8287ad?at=default](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/commits/89e10db00fc0bf2779b11a50c8fb9b401c8287ad?at=default)
content.html:
I modified the DisplayPlugin tests to not rely on the Displays widget in #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/commits/10d4992697ab3833b7283b4ede891a7e20e3e71b?at=default

~~~

content.raw: In the end, all plugin configs end up embedded in the top-level `.config` document, so as far as I can tell it's the same situation. I think the only problem, as you said, would be indentation, which I think is a small price to pay...
content.html: In the end, all plugin configs end up embedded in the top-level .config document, so as far as I can tell it's the same situation. I think the only problem, as you said, would be indentation, which I think is a small price to pay...

content.raw: Yeah, I saw that the Plugins return a string: it’s more reasonable for them since they’re not nested into the document like display plugin configs \(i.e. plugin configs are top-level elements in the config file\), so it is easy to just append their entire string to the overall config string. To explain the approach for future readers: It’s not so simple with display plugins since their config needs to end up _nested_ inside the Displays' plugin config. To accomplish that returning a string here, we’d need to parse the returned string back into an XML document to insert it in the right place of the Displays' config XML \(assuming we want correct indenting etc\), and I think for that you’d need a new TinyXML2 document, which then doesn’t work well with the original document, etc etc etc.
content.html: Yeah, I saw that the Plugins return a string: it’s more reasonable for them since they’re not nested into the document like display plugin configs (i.e. plugin configs are top-level elements in the config file), so it is easy to just append their entire string to the overall config string. To explain the approach for future readers: It’s not so simple with display plugins since their config needs to end up nested inside the Displays' plugin config. To accomplish that returning a string here, we’d need to parse the returned string back into an XML document to insert it in the right place of the Displays' config XML (assuming we want correct indenting etc), and I think for that you’d need a new TinyXML2 document, which then doesn’t work well with the original document, etc etc etc.

update.description:
Loading configs

* Default config tags of ‘visible’, ‘scene’ and ‘title’ will be parsed by all display plugins individually in the DisplayPlugin base class' `Load` \(not ‘engine’ because ogre is required at the moment, e.g. because of [#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/69](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/69/add-setvisible-for-visual/diff)\)
* Custom configs can be passed through to display plugins via their `Initialize` method. GridDisplay, for example, can have the colour etc of its grid customised.

Saving configs

* General config properties are saved in `DisplayPlugin::Config`
* Custom configs can be saved by specifying e.g. `GridDisplay::CustomConfig`.

Tests have been added to check that the same state of e.g. GridDisplay can be reloaded after modifying the grid’s properties.
update.title: Loading/saving of display plugin configs

content.raw: Ahh this kind of complication on tinyxml is why I was hoping to take it away from the public API eventually (issue #7). That's why the plugins return their configs as a string that we just append to the final document. We can leave the current implementation like this, but in the future it would be nice to avoid it.
content.html: Ahh this kind of complication on tinyxml is why I was hoping to take it away from the public API eventually (issue #7). That's why the plugins return their configs as a string that we just append to the final document. We can leave the current implementation like this, but in the future it would be nice to avoid it.
